desc.p: The local currency equivalent of the bought amount (AMOUNT.1).
This figure is originally calculated on line when the record is first updated/created. it will subsequently be revalued every night and reflect the current local currency equivalent position.
Standard Amount Format.
Example:
If a foreign exchange deal is entered as :-
Buy CCy ITL Sell CCy JPY Buy Amount 1,000,000 Sell Amount 5,000,000
Assume deal entered in company NG0010001, currency market 1 is used, position type is trading (TR), and value date of deal is 19930325
Then the following two position records will be raised :- Position Id - NG00100011TR25ITLJPY19930325 AMOUNT.1 -1,000,000 AMOUNT.2 5,000,000 LCY.EQUIV -23,000
Position Id - NG00100011TR25JPYITL19930325 AMOUNT.1 5,000,000 AMOUNT.2 -1,000,000 LCY.EQUIV 23,000

Note: All foreign exchange transfers arising from non FX applications, ie. Funds Transfer, Tellere, etc, will create four position records, one for bought currency against local, one for local against bought currency, one for sold currency against local, and one for local against sold currency. Only Foreign Exchange deals will maintain cross currency positions, wheras all other applications will maintain positions against the local currency.
This file is for display purposes only, no input is allowed.
CONTENTS
Field No Field Name
0 POSITION ID 1 AMOUNT 1 2 AMOUNT 2 3 LCY EQUIV 4.1 TXN REF NO 5 FWD REVAL POSTED
Unique key identifying the position record.
The POSITION ID is made up of the following structure :- [CO][CM][PT][DD][B.CCY][S.CCY][V.DATE] Where:
CO - Company Code (eg NG0010001) CM - Currency Market PT - Position Type DD - Dealer Desk B.CCY - Bought Currency S.CCY - Sold Currency V.DATE - Value date

Each time a deal or process that generates cross currency entries is entered into the system, then the above position id is made up from the transaction details, and this record will either be updated or created.
A concatenation of the following elements: Company code; Currency Market; Position Type; Dealer Desk; Bought Currency; Sold Currency; Value Date. See details below.
Amount in currency 2 for associated SYSTEM.DATE
For position records that have a forward value date (last element of the Position Id), records the total profit/loss revaluation figure posted to date.

If forward currency positions are required to be revalued (This is determined by the REVALUE.FWD.AL field on the FX.PARAMETERS file), then the amount revalued and posted to date is held in this field.
Standard Amount Format.

This will originally contain the amount sold against the amount bought (AMOUNT.1). It will subsequently be revalued every night against the bought currency.
This revaluation is calculated by re-calculating AMOUNT.2 from AMOUNT.1 using the current mid market rates.
